description: From Middle English sikness, from Old English sēocnes. Synchronically analyzable as sick +‎ -ness.

entries.meaning: The quality or state of being sick or diseased; illness.
examples: Trust not too much your now resistless charms; Those, age or sickness soon or late disarms.

entries.meaning: Nausea; qualmishness; as, sickness of stomach.
(linguistics) The analogical misuse of a rarer or marked grammatical case in the place of a more common or unmarked case.
